attributes.action: Parent and Child Parking Badge
attributes.background: There are motorists out there that park in parent and child parking spaces when they don't have children, then there is no spaces for those motorists that the are designed for.
attributes.additional_details: There should be a parking badge created for mortorists that are parents to be able to park in the parent & child spaces, working in the same way as the disabled badges. If a motorist wants one they should provide proof they have children (under 12 ) and they drive a car. The badge must have the license plate on so it can't be fraudaulantly used by anyone else. The government should create such a badge which must be renewed every time you get a new car.

attributes.action: Launch a National Consultation on Reducing Plastic Usage
attributes.background: Blue Planet 2 has started a national talk on reducing plastic usage, we need to start reducing the hidden plastics in retailers, e.g. Plastic cutlery, wrapping around magazines, DVDs, CDs, Cigarettes etc. A national consultation is needed with companies to reduce the usage of plastics.

attributes.action: Issue legal guidance that IVA completion certificates should be issued promptly
attributes.background: An IVA makes people live on a tight budget for 5 years in an effort to pay back what they can. These people can't start to rebuild their lives or their credit rating until they get their completion certificate. This currently takes months and sometimes over 6 months. We suggest it should be 30 days.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.iva.co.uk/iva-completion-certificates-petition

attributes.action: Change the TV licensing law so that your TV licence covers you away from home.
attributes.background:
If you have a licence and travel on a bus whilst watching iPlayer you are covered. If you live or holiday in a caravan you are covered. 
If you stay in a hotel, B&B or holiday home you ARE NOT and require the owner of that establishment to have a licence.
attributes.additional_details:
You could be potentially breaking the law without even realising it.
I am one of those many law abiding citizens who have to work away from home due to lack of suitable work in my home area. I own a TV licence at home. During the week I rent a cottage off my employer. I have no utility bills, do not have the right to vote in this constituency and I am not registered with a GP here and yet I am required, by law, to have a TV licence - Why?
If you think that this should be changed please vote.

attributes.action: Changes required under the Universal Credit to support workers!
attributes.background:
make uploading documentation for childcare costs or any other evidence available online - this will enable working families to upload in a timely manner!

monies to be paid in advance for childcare costs as ALL nurseries UK wide require advance payment!!
attributes.additional_details: I am a single mother to 2 under 3's who works as a manager but is newly single and having to rely on a system whether the childcare costs and housing costs have not been paid for the last 2 months leaving me in a very difficult situation that nobody else (IN WORK) SHOULD GO THROUGH!

attributes.action: Stop introducing fixed tenancies to tenants
attributes.background: New legislation is putting forward that fixed term tenancies will be given to everyone who is signing a new tenancy. This means tenants with existing secure tenancies will loose their secure tenancy example through mutual exchange and through the bidding system.
attributes.additional_details: Tenants are given opportunity to move through mutual exchange and being forced to give up their secure tenancy because they need extra space or to downsize. Now it’s a choice of quality of living or a secure tenancy. With these new laws coming in no one is secure people with vulnerability should be excempt from these laws. It would be better that those who need to move through mutual exchange should keep their existing tenancy status ie secure tenancy and move that over to the swapper property.

attributes.action: Re-run the appointments process for the board of the Office for Students
attributes.background: The Commissioner for Public Appointments has identified serious governance failings and political interference in the appointment of board members of the new Office for Students. All board members should be asked to immediately resign and the appointments process be re-run in  proper manner.
attributes.additional_details: The full report of the Commissioner can be accessed here: https://publicappointmentscommissioner.independent.gov.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Commissioner-for-Public-Appointments-Investigation-OFS-Final-.pdf

attributes.action: The immigration amnesty of Grenfell survivors should be indefinitely extended
attributes.background: ‘Foreign’ survivors of the Grenfell Tower fire were granted a temporary 12-month immigration “amnesty” for them to stay in the U.K. regardless of their immigration status but may still face deportation after that.

attributes.action: Car Tax to start from the day you Tax your car and end the day you sell.
attributes.background: If someone buys a car from me mid month and they part exchange their old car they are losing out twice. This is because the new car tax is back dated to the beginning of the month, and the old car can only claim every complete month remaining!

attributes.action: Put retirement age back to 60 for females and 60 for men.
attributes.background: I am 58 years old. Working with all sorts of conditions: COPD; Glucoma; 2 bad discs; Arthritis. To try and get time off to see a doctor is almost impossible. Getting up is a struggle. But I am not entitled to disability as I can dress wash and feed myself. Everyday is a struggle.

attributes.action: Raise income tax by 0.25%, ring-fenced for NHS and post-discharge social care.
attributes.background:
The NHS is at crisis point with A&E having patients in all corners and in a queue of ambulances outside It needs extra money to provide for good quality services and the type of social care that would help to stop bed blocking in hospitals.

Waiting lists for clinics  and tests are too long.
attributes.additional_details:
Most people I know would be prepared to pay more income tax as long as it is used as extra money for the NHS and social care to enable discharge from hospital when nursing is no longer needed.

Doctor and nurse staff morale is low because of the pressures in trying to care for sick people without the resources to do so.

Bed occupancy is at 94% in England which is not entirely due to influenza as elective surgery was cancelled to cover this. The NHS could not cope with a further crisis.

attributes.action: No foreign aid to Pakistan for supporting terrorism.
attributes.background: Pakistan soil has become a training camp for terrorists. The government of Pakistan have been supporting terrorists; UK foreign aid therefore goes to terrorists. Government must immediately stop all foreign aid to Pakistan.
attributes.additional_details: On one hand, they show that they have taken action to tackle terrorism; on the other hand, they support terrorism for their own gain. Granting foreign aid to Pakistan seems as if we are financially supporting the terrorists. Many terrorist-related events in Afghanistan, India and other countries are initiated in Pakistan. Recent bomb blasts in Afghanistan killed hundreds of innocent people.

attributes.action: Mandatory professional assessments for mental health decisions in organisations
attributes.background: Studying and working in the the field of mental health, I have seen both loved ones and service users lose out on employment opportunities and even be removed from positions due to misunderstanding and lay person judgement of their condition. This should not happen, and doesn't for other disability.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst it is currently possible to argue a duty of care motive for treating those with a diagnosed mental health condition differently; whether this is the case should be reviewed by a mental health professional. Otherwise, limitations placed on an individual can constitute disability discrimination. This is not currently mandatory, with occupational health doing this job if anyone. This is more true in voluntary organisations where loss of role is not termination of employment.

attributes.action: Make plastic packaging show images of the damage they cause to the environment
attributes.background: Putting images or warnings about the damage caused to our environment, particularly marine life, by single use plastic bags and packaging will deter people from buying these items and push large producers of such items to use biodegradable alternatives. We cannot let nature suffer our waste anymore.
attributes.additional_details: Walking through supermarkets we often pick things up for their convenience without giving a second thought to what happens to the packaging once we’re done with it. Recently however, we have seen shocking footage of marine life facing the consequences of human waste such as a mother whale not wanting to leave behind her dead calf, poisoned by plastics. This cannot go on. Seeing the devastation caused as you’re about to pick up something wrapped in plastic might make you think twice about it.

attributes.action: Ban the Commercial speed restrictions on vehicles such as duel use pickups,
attributes.background: Vehicles such as Dual Cab pickups are still subjected to commercial speed restrictions on certain roads due to their curb weight even thou they are someone’s personal vehicle and not used for commercial use, remove these restrictions for personal use vehicles,
attributes.additional_details: If your pickup exceeds a unladen weight of 2048 kilos it has speed restrictions on certain roads which is rubbish as most modern cars such as range rovers weight sometimes over 3 tonne, just because a vehicle is deemed commercial doesn’t mean it should be restricted, personal use commercial vehicles not being used for business shouldn’t be subjected to this law, as new pick ups have better safety equipment than when this law was written,

attributes.action: Make St George's Day in England and St Andrew's day in Wales public holidays
attributes.background: Scotland and Northern Ireland both get public holidays for their patron saint, why should England and Wales not get the same privilege?

attributes.action: Build Nuclear Bunkers sufficient for the population accounting for growth.
attributes.background: There is and always has been since creation a threat of nuclear attack, currently as individuals there is effectively nothing we can to protect ourselves from an attack for example from North Korea, in the event of nuclear attack millions of people would be helplessly destroyed.
attributes.additional_details: I would ask that the government ensure the construction regardless of the financial cost of nuclear shelters in major urban population centres for all persons of the area and accounting for influx of peoples to the shelters from outside of the area and population growth so that people can protect themselves from a nuclear attack, I would ask people be quickly and indiscriminately accepted into these shelters and essentials be available for prolonged life from within the shelter.

attributes.action: Ban working MPs and donors of over £5,000 to a political party from honours.
attributes.background: Implementing this ban will reduce the chances of people using their position to get honours, reduce corruption and help those who truly deserve honours receive them.
attributes.additional_details:
Working MPs are a special case compared to working musicians, sportsmen etc. 

Only MPs have the ability to directly affect the government that is in power and the laws within which we all live under and therefore require special rules.

Wealthy people should not use their money to influence a democratically elected government.

attributes.action: Increase maternity SMP (33 weeks) to match national minimum wage
attributes.background: UK is ranked one of the lowest when it comes to decent maternity pay. SMP is below minimum wage, why? With all the things we are doing for equality and empowerment of women, maternity pay is being ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the financial strain more women are not returning back to work or they are returning back to work earlier than they need to and miss out on bonding with their new born. This causes us to lose skilled women at the workplace and not giving importance to an upbringing of a child.

Is it fair that SMP is below minimum wage? Why is it not being matched? 

There are so many benefits that a change to this can bring, families will be in a better financial situation and more likely to return work.

attributes.action: To be made law that all public buildings in the UK to fly the Union Flag
attributes.background: Many countries around the world take pride in their national flag it seems the that UK is almost afraid to fly its flag for the fear of upsetting someone. After BREXIT we will once again be an independent country and should fly our flag as often and conspicuously as possible on all public buildings

attributes.action: Abolish Political Parties and create a collective body of independent MPs.
attributes.background: Great ideas can come from anyone. The possibility that a great idea will fall by the wayside due to some in-built bias of the current Party political/adversarial setup is wrong. Our current Parliamentary system encourages and rewards political bullying (from the whips) and loyalty to the Party line.
attributes.additional_details: Independent MPs would strengthen the relationship (and possibly form new types of relationships) between MPs and their constituents. An MP who today finds it necessary to follow the Party line, which in many cases is against their constituents beliefs, will find it easier to be more in tune with the people they represent and 100% accountable to the same. We have had enough of adversarial wrangling and it is time to try something new - a collective Parliament as is evident anywhere else in nature

attributes.action: Require Train Companies to refund and/or exchange advance-purchase train tickets
attributes.background: Trains do not refund or even at least exchange advance purchase tickets. There is no economic value to society or benefit to the customer for this. If people's plans change, or they mistakenly book the wrong date, they should be allowed to refund it within a certain timeframe.
attributes.additional_details: You can't get a refund on an advance purchase ticket months in advance, unless you exchange it for another advance purchase ticket at the cost of £10. This is not fair for consumers. This is simply companies trying to squeeze out every penny they can from the consumer. Megabus charge £1 to change your tickets, but trains charge £10, and if you're train ticket is around £10 - £30 anyway, on balance it's cheaper buying a new one. This would also help trains stop overreserving seats in carriages too.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health Awareness Training Mandatory for All Employers and Managers
attributes.background: Mental health problems have a greater impact on people’s ability to work than any other group of disorders. At the moment, we have no mandatory protocol, training or support for people who suffer with Mental Illness and this usually ends in dismissal by a manager or resignation of an employee.
attributes.additional_details: I, as well as thousands of other people in the UK, find it hard to talk out about Mental Health, especially when our Job is concerned. We can’t come to terms with telling our Manager as we fear for our job. People suffering with Depression, Anxiety or any other Mental Health condition should be supported at work. This Petition is to make Employers and Managers carry out the correct training to educate them on what we go through on a daily basis and ways to avoid our conditions spiralling

attributes.action: Make tax incentives and laws for companies allowing people to work  from home.
attributes.background: Because a lot of people travel into work in cities we are overloading the traffic infrastructure, creating pollution. parking problems and destroying country villages. Give companies incentives to allow them to support home workers, remove laws making companies for being responsible for home areas.
attributes.additional_details: companies are made responsible for the environment that people are working in at home, allow workers to opt out of this protection so they can work at home. Companies should only be responsible for the computers and equipment they supply nothing else. this will allow people with children to work from home. also companies can use more part time workers.

attributes.action: Change the way fines i.e. Speeding/Drunk and Disorderly are calculated.
attributes.background: Instead of a fixed price fine we should have a proportional fine so it affects each person the same way, it should be 10% of the offending persons average weekly wage (10% of 1/52th, 1 weeks worth, of last year's net pay) or a minimum of £80, whichever is the greater.
attributes.additional_details:
This way it have much more of an equal affect upon the culprit and even out some balance of a unfair prosecution system which effects the poorest more.

For example in October this year (2017) a professional footballer was caught speeding and was fined £440, alot of money for a person on minimum wage but does not have the same impact on someone reportedly earning £37,500 per week. This may be an extreme example however I feel this change allow punishment to be felt equally across the board.

attributes.action: Hold a Public Inquiry into >45000 extra deaths linked to austerity since 2010
attributes.background: A recent study published in the BMJ showed a correlation between cuts to social and healthcare funding and higher than expected national mortality rates since 2010. A Public Inquiry should be held in order to determine whether Government Austerity measures have led to an increase in death rate.
attributes.additional_details:
Long term under funding of health and social care services has led to widespread suffering, a decline physical and mental health and vulnerable people being put at risk. Lack of funding may also be responsible for >45000 deaths since 2010. If this is the case, harmful government action and policy must be reversed and responsible politicians held to account over these deaths.

Study: http://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/7/11/e017722

attributes.action: Pass legislation for the use of indelible ink pens mandatory for ALL elections.
attributes.background: In an age where pens are as cost effective as pencils, there is no excuse why the use of indelible ink pens should not be made mandatory. Old arguments on cost and potential for ink to smudge are not relevant today. However, a perception votes cast using a pencil can be manipulated, is a concern.

attributes.action: Make national rugby accessible to all to watch
attributes.background:
Home nation rugby should be available to all through live coverage on terrestrial tv channels.
It is absurd that one of our home nation teams playing one of our most popular sports is now only available to those who can afford to, and pre-plan to use subscription television.
attributes.additional_details: How can we be expected to support & celebrate our own nation in a sport in which we are world class when we are unable to watch without subscribing? The move of national sport from terrestrial TV to subscription services is going to gradually quench the ability for supporters to follow their nation & ultimately reduce participation in the sport. Not only will this reduce the passion for our nation but reduce any future prospects for a world leading team when we are at the very peak of the game.

attributes.action: Increase the funding for additional support for prison officers well-being.
attributes.background:
Prison officers are in a highly demanding and challenging job that requires readily available support systems in terms of both their mental health and well-being. 
We are petitioning for:
More counselling with independent professional counsellors to deal with mental health in the work place.
attributes.additional_details:
7159 assaults on prison officers and serious assaults on prison officers has trebled from previous year (MOJ, 2017); impacting their psychological and physical safety at work, overall effecting the prison system in whole.
We think this intervention would be beneficial for prison officers, prisoners and society as a whole.

attributes.action: Move pedestrian crossing buttons further away from roadside for safety.
attributes.background: I believe that the position of 'Crossing Buttons' is too near the road. Children often run towards the button, wanting to be the one that presses it. A trip or stumble could easily result in them falling into the road or cause a motorist to swerve/brake etc. Bringing risk of accident or fatality.

attributes.action: Call for all people who mentally cause suicide to be prosecuted for MURDER
attributes.background:
This petition calls for 'murder' to be redefined so that if it can be proven that one person has committed suicide as a result of another person's/ other people's actions, a murder charge can result.
The punishment will be a starting point of a minimum of 15 years in prison (12 years for under 18s)
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are killing themselves due to other people's evil actions. There is currently no crime that has been committed.
Manslaughter is 'the crime of killing a human being without malice aforethought'. That basically means that if you physically kill somebody without intent or the mental capacity to understand your actions.
To force a person to suicide, a person must have such great intent to harm others. There is malice! Murder could be 'killing a human deliberately or due to bullying'

attributes.action: Make it illegal to kill llamas in slaughterhouses.
attributes.background: It is actually legal to kill and eat llama if it is killed in an approved slaughterhouse. We personally love llamas and would like to make it illegal for llamas to be killed.

attributes.action: Free Prescriptions for all under 25s in full time education
attributes.background: It is currently free for full time students aged 18 and under to get prescription medication. I’ve just turned 19 and will now have to pay for my medication whilst being a full time university student, so it may become that I cannot afford it every month and forfeit my health due to financial issues
attributes.additional_details: Many students may not see their gp due to this. I think that a valid student ID should give exemption to paying for prescriptions when being a first time student. The age limit needs raising from 18 to 25 to account for this.

attributes.action: Insist the Government give a 50% discount for Council Tax single occupants
attributes.background: At the moment single occupants get a 25% reduction in their Council Tax which is most unfair. In houses with more than one person there are more like to be dual or more incomes, so there the reduction should be 50% to single occupant earners or pensioners as they are pay 25% more on one income.

attributes.action: Ban fruit and veg being wrapped/packaged in plastic by 2020
attributes.background: The UK government want to eliminate all avoidable plastic waste by 2042, so why not start where its easy. Most fruit and veg don't need packaging at all.  It will be a great place to start to help eliminate all plastic waste which is harmful to the environment and all life, including people.
attributes.additional_details:
Goverments environment plan: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/25-year-environment-plan 

Information about plastic pollution: www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/science-environment-42264788

attributes.action: Local councils  to provide drinking fountains in towns and cities.
attributes.background: The consumption of clean water is a basic human need and millions of plastic bottles end up in landfills or in oceans to be eaten by marine life then into the food chain and human beings. Ask Parliament to implement a legal duty for local councils to provide drinking fountains in towns and cities.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence for the danger of the breakdown of plastic is overwhelming, 
both in terms of damage to the environment, the food chain and in human bodies. This is an unknown health hazard and any efforts to reduce the use of plastic will be beneficial.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-43388870 
http://www.plasticpollutioncoalition.org/ 
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plastic_pollution 
https://www.lifewithoutplastic.com 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-42264788 
http://www.sciencemag.org/tags/plastic-pollution 
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-018-03104-3 
https://plasticoceans.org/the-facts/ 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/environment/2018/jan/25/new-network-of-water-refill-points-aims-to-reduce-englands-plastic-waste

attributes.action: Lower the driving age to 15
attributes.background: Many students have to walk to school due to their families working or broken families. Result? many students get involved in alleyway gangs some can then skip school. If these students were allowed to drive they wouldn't get involved in drugs, but instead they wud be able to get to school and learn.

attributes.action: Change the Yellow Box Junction Law to allow motorist to wait for upto 20 seconds
attributes.background:
The law is being misused by Local Councils as a business by installing more cameras and Yellow box junctions and generate millions by issuing tickets for few seconds.
A 20 second exemption should be given  to wait due to unavoidable circumstances and, also in the event no obstruction is caused.
attributes.additional_details: The intention of Honourable MPs for the Yellow Box junction law were not to generate money but to ensure smooth flow of traffic from the right in the event of heavy traffic on the main road. If the council were not stopped they will also convert KEEP CLEAR and T- Junctions into Yellow box junctions and will install CCTV to generate millions.

attributes.action: Stop firms from increasing subscription prices during a contract.
attributes.background: When customers sign up to mobile, broadband, landline or a TV contract there is always a clause that the company can increase their prices in line with inflation.  A contract price should remain the same throughout its duration. This unfair practice needs to stop.

attributes.action: Erase CCJ immediately from records once debts are fully paid.
attributes.background: A CCJ on record for 6 years can be the end of normal life for most. 6 months career break alone is dangerous, 6 years is destructive. That Mortgages will be lost, homes break under financial burden, people look to emigrate over a £300 registered debt is ludicrous & the judgements too easily applied.

attributes.action: Make booking fees illegal where tickets are only available from one vendor
attributes.background: Ticketing websites regularly charge customers the added cost of a booking fee when using their services despite it often being only website on which tickets are available. This enables vendors to charge whatever price they want knowing if people want the tickets they must pay the charge.
attributes.additional_details: When using sites such as Ticketmaster there is the added cost of a booking fee with the purchase of tickets. In many cases the ticket is only available from this website allowing a monopoly over their sale, this in turn leaves customers open to exploitation as vendors can charge excessive booking fees under this monopoly. Under this proposal booking fees would be banned unless tickets for the same event were on sale elsewhere creating competition among ticket vendors to offer the best price.

attributes.action: The penalty for using a mobile phone while driving  1year ban and £500 fine.
attributes.background: Too many people are being injured and killed on our roads the present penalties are not a deterrent. Too many people are ignoring the issue.

attributes.action: End PFI in the NHS
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, are disappointed that the Prime Minister has not ruled out the possibility of US companies having any involvement in the NHS as part of a post-Brexit trade deal with the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
We are concerned that allowing such involvement will lock the British taxpayer into long-term debt, especially should any NHS trust involved require additional funding.

We are further concerned that the needs of private financiers and banks will dictate the shape, size and scale of our health services and that the high costs of PFI debt charges means that the NHS will be unable to operate as it would have done through conventional procurement funding.

We therefore call upon the British Government not only to rule out US or any other foreign company involvement in the NHS post-Brexit but to commit to no extension to or further PFI funding arrangements across all NHS services.

attributes.action: Rule out involving our NHS in a trade deal with the US
attributes.background: Theresa May has refused to rule out trading away our NHS in a deal with the USA. We want to show that that is not the will of the people.

attributes.action: Change the criteria for PIP assessments
attributes.background: Many disabled have been taken off their benefits despite no improvement to their condition. The PIP criteria does not adequately assess the effects of disability and is far too severe. It should be changed under the advice of doctors and disabled people.
attributes.additional_details: To qualify for the disability part of working tax credits you must receive PIP, but nowhere in PIP is your ability to work assessed. The PIP assessment is unconcerned with your quality of life and tries to fit disabled people into narrow tick boxes which often aren’t appropriate. Many feel that the PIP assessment is poorly suited to its purpose. The general public, disabled in particular, should be consulted and in partnership with doctors, a new system drawn up.

attributes.action: Ban serving MPs holding paid directorships and significant 'outside interests'
attributes.background: MPs are our representatives, who, at present are paid an adequate £74,962 in line with inflation; with expenses to carry out their role. Yet, in 2015 some 180 MPs had second jobs, earning a total of £7.4m a year. Of these 112 were Conservative MPs and 43 were Labour.
attributes.additional_details: This is wrong. MPs are elected solely to represent the people and should, therefore, dedicate their full attention to fulfilling this duty, without the need for additional employment.

attributes.action: national insurance to be used solely to fund the NHS
attributes.background: National insurance payments to be used solely to fund the NHS and social care budget for the elderly . as suggested by various forward thinking politicians and not be used as another stealth tax

attributes.action: A final referendum on EU membership at the same time as a General Election.
attributes.background:
Once this Government has completed their negotiations with the EU27, they should resign and a General Election be called before implementing our departure from the EU.

At the same time a binding referendum on EU membership be held and the subsequent Parliament be obliged to implement the result.
attributes.additional_details: This would ensure a proper debate on the issues, with the electorate clear about the consequences of their votes.  There would be no reason to object to the result with all the facts known and new Parliament elected fully aware of its obligations.

attributes.action: Make all, or most left turn traffic lights into permanent 'GIVE WAY' junctions
attributes.background: In order to reduce emissions of the country, especially in cities, all filter traffic lights and wherever safe, turning left should be on a giving way to the flow of traffic on the road you're joining basis, this would reduce journey times, congestion, and the amount of traffic remaining stationary.
attributes.additional_details: This is guaranteed to reduce emissions on cars of all ages and fuel types, as well as saving fuel or battery power. This will also keep the aspect of safety given by traffic lights, for example, at a 4 way junction, traffic heading straight on or right would still be on a light based rotation.

attributes.action: Keep accepting credit card payments for all tax payments
attributes.background: The Government are stopping accepting credit card payments from 13th January 2018 - please sign to keep the acceptance of credit card payments after this date.
attributes.additional_details: Small business owner
